{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3551912,"name":"Ofek Harel","username":"OfekHarel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ofekharel/{size}/134749_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T16:20:54.314Z","cooked":"

We’re experiencing a weird behavior from our Pigeon 2.
When the robot is disabled we see a huge drift in the yaw angle, and again the robot isn’t moving at all.
We know that another team from our current competition has the same issue.
We are clueless,
We tried to replace the module itself, didn’t work.

Some technical info:

  • Phoenix 6
  • Pigeon 2 with the latest firmware
  • connected to the carnivore bus

We ran into this same issue a couple days ago. We tried switching Pigeons, but that didn’t solve the problem. Then we recalibrated our Pigeon and the drift went away. Have you calibrated your Pigeon yet? You can do it through CTRE’s Phoenix Tuner X: Pigeon 2.0 Calibration

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-09T16:39:56.102Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":78.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494855,"topic_slug":"pigeon-2-drifting","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://v6.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/2024/docs/tuner/pigeon-cal.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pigeon 2.0 Calibration","clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57331,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5675 Team Captain"},"post_url":"/t/pigeon-2-drifting/494855/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3551978,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-09T17:54:45.012Z","cooked":"

You should also consider checking if the Pigeon is particularly close to any strong magnets(Mainly the ones in your motors). We’ve had some problems with gyro drift in the past and this turned out to be one of the causes.
